titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Judith Montell Papers ALBA.305
titlestmt.author: Heather Mulliner

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-11-30 15:12:09 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 11 record cartons, 2 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, and 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: This collection contains interview transcripts, collected photographs, ephemera, and video clips for Judith Montell's documentaries about the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigades (VALB). Judith Montell is a documentary filmmaker who has made three films about the Abraham Lincoln Brigades including, Forever Activists: Stories from the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, which received an Academy Award Nomination for Best Achievement in Documentary Feature. Two boxes contain transcripts of interviews with Abraham Lincoln Brigade veterans, as well as images created and collected by Montell of VALB events. The bulk of the collection consists of video tapes, which include original footage shot by Montell, collected footage, copies of her documentary Forever Activists, and videos of VALB related films produced by others.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives in January 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.016. 5 boxes of videos from the film Forever Activists are also included in this collection. Tamiment does not have information about the acquisition of these materials. The accession number associated with these videos is 1950.045.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are in the order in which the were received by the donor. These materials have not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Judith Montell is a documentary filmmaker. Her first feature-length film Forever Activists: Stories from the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, released in 1990, received an Academy Award Nomination for Best Achievement in Documentary Feature. She has made several other documentaries about the Abraham Lincoln Brigades including a sequel to Forever Activists, You are History, You Are Legend, which she released for the 60th Anniversary of the Spanish Civil War, and the film Professional Revolutionary: The Life of Saul Wellman about the Abraham Lincoln Brigades veteran. She is an honorary board member of the Abraham Lincoln Brigades Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Judith Montell Papers; ALBA 305; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning materials in the collection were moved into archival housing, and described at the collection level. Six CD-R disks have been inventoried but have not been forensically imaged. Files on these disks have not been arranged. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

5 boxes of video tapes were originally established as the Forever Activists: Judith Montell Videos Collection (ALBA VIDEO 001). This collection remained unprocessed, and in 2018 these materials were identified as the same collection as ALBA 305 and were added to this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains interview transcripts, collected photographs, ephemera, and video clips for Judith Montell's documentaries about the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigades (VALB). Two boxes contain transcripts of interviews with Abraham Lincoln Brigade veterans, as well as images created and collected by Montell of VALB events. The bulk of the collection consists of video tapes, which include original footage shot by Montell, collected footage, copies of her documentary Forever Activists, and videos of VALB related films produced by others.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Judy Montell was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
